org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang

Class TriggerWhenClauseTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase
            • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.TriggerWhenClauseTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class TriggerWhenClauseTest
extends BaseJDBCTestCase
    Tests for the WHEN clause in CREATE TRIGGER statements, added in DERBY-534.

      • initializeConnection

        protected void initializeConnection(java.sql.Connection conn)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from class: BaseJDBCTestCase
        Allow a sub-class to initialize a connection to provide consistent connection state for its tests. Called once for each time these method calls open a connection:
        • getConnection()
        • openDefaultConnection()
        • openConnection(database)
        • getDefaultConnection(String connAttrs)
        Default action is to not modify the connection's state from the initialization provided by the data source.
        Overrides:
        initializeConnection in class BaseJDBCTestCase
        Parameters:
        conn - Connection to be intialized
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Error setting the initial state.

      • intProcedure

        public static void intProcedure(int i)
        A procedure that takes an int argument and adds it to the procedureCalls list. Can be used as a stored procedure to verify that a trigger has been called. Particularly useful in BEFORE triggers, as they are not allowed to modify SQL data.
        Parameters:
        i - an integer

      • testVeryLongWhenClause

        public void testVeryLongWhenClause()
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        The WHEN clause text is stored in a LONG VARCHAR column in the SYS.SYSTRIGGERS table. This test case verifies that the WHEN clause is not limited to the usual LONG VARCHAR maximum length (32700 characters).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • testRoutineModifiesSQLData

        public void testRoutineModifiesSQLData()
                                throws java.sql.SQLException

        SQL:2011, part 2, 11.49 <trigger definition>, syntax rule 11 says that the WHEN clause shall not contain routines that possibly modifies SQL data. Derby does not currently allow functions to be declared as MODIFIES SQL DATA. It does allow procedures to be declared as MODIFIES SQL DATA, but the current grammar does not allow procedures to be invoked from a WHEN clause. So there's currently no way to invoke routines that possibly modifies SQL data from a WHEN clause.

        This test case verifies that it is not possible to declare a function as MODIFIES SQL DATA, and that it is not possible to call a procedure from a WHEN clause. If support for any of those features is added, this test case will start failing as a reminder that code must be added to prevent routines that possibly modifies SQL data from being invoked from a WHEN clause.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • testAggregates

        public void testAggregates()
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Verify that aggregates (both built-in and user-defined) can be used in a WHEN clause.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
